Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2008 02:36AM wackyjackie wrote: Econmom, Welcome to the most helpful place in your new world.  I'm sorry you had to join at all but you found the right spot.  There is even a triple negative thread.  Know that you can ask any one of us ANYTHING on this site and there are many wise, experienced women who will help you. I pray for you and your family and my advice to you right now would be take one hour at a time and try to read and learn as much as you can.   I agree with the ladies above, being positive helps the healing tremendously but there are days where you need to let go and worry only about you.  I pray for your strength. Hugs, Jackie

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2007 01:23AM wackyjackie wrote: welcome roxy. sorry you had to join. i started my journey in may, 2007. i had bilateral mast. on 7/3/07 and axillary node dissection 8/7/07. i am getting ready to start chemo on 8/15/07. just get as much info as you can and ask a lot of questions. this site is the best for any information. depend on friends, family and neighbors to help with your children. get a notebook and keep track of everything. you will hear half of what you're being told. take one day at a time and each step will bring you closer to freedom. god bless you and your family....hugs, jackie
